content.description: Start matched on the incut rail as for wood grub and immediately climb left through a series of edges to a technical slab finish
content.location: East face of the Dragon Egg - dead center

content.description: Stand start on two good in-cut crimps. Climb straight out the bulge on crimps and pinches to a slabby finish on good holds. The landing has been improved but is not ideal.
Stand start on the right side of the west facing slab of the Dragon Egg - this problem is to the right of Dark Tranquility. Lots of good edges and feet make this a good warm-up for the area.
Start standing on good holds. Traverse to the left on good holds and top-out on the apex. Good warm-up.
content.location: Just behind the large slab on The Dragon Egg.

content.description: Stand start in the crack climb up and left into juggy underclings to an easy finish. A more challenging sit start can be added.
content.location: Trailside on the Dragon Egg. Look for the main crack.

content.description: Stand start on decent holds, utilize good holds climbing straight up the crack. Has been done from a difficult sit start.... one move wonder to finish on this classic V1. At the large blocky feature you can also climb using underclings at a similar grade.
content.location: As you walk up the drainage this problem is rather obvious - trailside look for the crack on the east facing side of the boulder.

content.description: Classic highball elden slab problem - decent holds and good stances make this a great problem to test slab technique - Start matched left facing sidepull jugs, climb up on small incut crimps to gain another big jug. Head up and left following the dark streaked slab to an easy top-out.
content.location: On the large west-facing slab on The Dragon Egg.

content.description: Squat start on two obvious sidepulls and slap your way up the prominent arete leading to an easy slab finish.
content.location: Blunt arete on the Dragon Egg left of Elvis Crack.

content.description: Stand start on some jugs and climb straight up to a somewhat challenging mantle... probably the crux. Not the best rock on this one.
content.location: From the trail this problem is directly uphill to the right from Wood Grub

content.description: The Dragon Egg hosts a wide range of difficulty, mostly offering some good technical movement on mostly vertical to slabby angles. This is a great boulder to warm up on and test your edging ability sometimes high off the deck.
